translation.en: [woman] Come on, can't you go any faster?
[man] Kate, FDNY says six people are trapped in the fire. Are you there yet?
translation.ko: 케이트, 소방국에서 6명이 화재 현장에 고립됐대, 아직이야?

translation.en: [Kate] Yeah, almost. Go, go, go. Park right there.
translation.ko: 거의 다 왔어요 빨리빨리, 저쪽에 주차해

translation.en: [man 2] Yeah, yeah. I see it, I see it.
[man 1] Coming to you live in five minutes.
-[Kate] Okay, we'll be ready. -[man 2] We've got this.
[man 1] Four engines on the scene. More on the way.
translation.ko: 소방차 4대가 현장에 있고 더 가는 중이래

translation.en: -Got feet on the ground yet? -Yeah, we just got here.
[man 1] Get some cutaways. We'll do a stand-up on the third block.
translation.ko: 현장 그림 보내주고 3번째 꼭지로 스탠드업 가지

translation.en: No, David, it's no good.
The police have the media at least 50 yards out.
translation.ko: 경찰이 50m 이내론 접근 못 하게 막고 있어요

translation.en: I'm gonna get us something exclusive.
-How are you gonna do that? -You know the drill. Give me the camera.
translation.ko: - 어쩌려고? - 이럴 때 하는 거 있잖아 카메라 줘

translation.en: Thanks.
-Hey. -Sir, please stay away from the barricade.
I just had a quick question. Do you know how this-- Oh.
Sorry.
Sorry about that, man.
All thumbs today.
[fireman 1] Need a ladder, south side. South side!
[fireman 2] Get Charlie up on the second floor.
[fireman 3] Need more pressure here.
[fireman 4] Open it up. We need more pressure on this one.
[fireman 5] They're EMT, let 'em through. Come on, guys. We gotta move here.
translation.ko: 구급대원 왔어, 길 열어줘 얼른 움직이자고!

translation.en: [woman] Come on, guys.
[fireman 1] Block that window out. Block that window.
[fireman 2] Give me a hand here.
[fireman] Hey! You gotta get out of here now. This fire's out of control.
translation.ko: 이봐요, 여기 있으면 안 돼요 불길이 어디로 번질지 몰라요

translation.en: It's okay, I've done this before.
Not like this, you haven't.
Look out!
Thank you.
You should get out now.
[woman] It's very hard to get any real...
[David] Ten seconds, Kate.
Yeah. Yeah, copy that. I'll be ready.
[man] Just make sure you get that. Good.
In five, four, three...
Channel 12 News has obtained exclusive footage
translation.ko: 채널 12 뉴스가 브루클린의 폐창고 화재 현장에서

translation.en: of firefighters battling the blaze at this abandoned warehouse in Brooklyn.
translation.ko: 화염과 싸우는 소방관들의 모습을 독점 입수했습니다

translation.en: New York City's finest at the FDNY
have already pulled out eight people from the inferno.
And the operation continues.
From Brooklyn, I'm Kate Bradley, Channel 12 News.
Wow. None of the other stations have anything like that.
translation.ko: 대박! 저런 그림 잡은 방송국은 우리뿐이야

translation.en: Nice footage, Josh.
Don't look at me. It was all Kate.
translation.ko: 나 보지 마 다 케이트가 찍은 거야

translation.en: Ooh, and it's getting a ton of views on our website.
translation.ko: 우리 홈페이지 조회 수 팍팍 올라가는데?

translation.en: Nice.
Kate, I just got off the phone with our legal department.
Wanna guess what they said about your report from the scene?
translation.ko: 자네 화재 보도 보고 뭐라는지 알아?

translation.en: Bravo?
-Good job? -Try reckless and dangerous.
translation.ko: 브라보, 아니면 잘한다? 또 그러기만 해, 회사 보험은 그런 스턴트는 커버 안 해주니까

translation.en: Our insurance doesn't cover stunts like that.
translation.ko: 또 그러기만 해, 회사 보험은 그런 스턴트는 커버 안 해주니까

translation.en: Stunts? I mean, I call that being a reporter.
It's got to stop.
Well, they didn't seem to mind when I got them that exclusive coverage
translation.ko: 법무팀은 제가 브롱크스의 붕괴된 공장 내부에서

translation.en: from inside the collapsed factory in the Bronx.
translation.ko: 특종 물어왔을 땐 신경 안 썼잖아요

translation.en: No, no, you see, actually, I did mind.
Station management are going nuts with all the risks you're taking.
translation.ko: 자네가 그렇게 겁 없이 덤빌 때마다 경영진이 식겁해

translation.en: [scoffs] Well, they seem to like the ratings. Knock it off, Kate. You hear me?
translation.ko: - 시청률은 좋아라 하잖아요 - 케이트, 내 말 알아듣지?

translation.en: -Yeah, loud and clear, boss. -Thank you.
-[Kate] So you said 12 people rescued? -[phone beeps]
Can I call you back? Thanks.
Hi, Dad. I saw your text, but I--
[man] I saw your report from the warehouse fire. I was worried.
translation.ko: 창고 화재 뉴스 보고 걱정 많이 했다

translation.en: It's not like you to ignore my texts.
I'm not ignoring you, Dad.
It's been a busy day, and I just got the fire investigator on the phone--
translation.ko: 종일 바빴고, 소방국 조사관이랑 통화 중이었는데...

translation.en: It's midnight and you're still working?
[Kate] Dad, I know you're calling me from the office.
Well, that's different. A senator's work is never done.
translation.ko: 난 다르지 상원의원 일은 원래 끝이 없거든

translation.en: You know, I wish you'd consider reporting on politics
instead of chasing fires and car crashes.
translation.ko: 화재 현장이나 교통사고만 쫓아다니지 말고 정치 뉴스를 해보지 그러니?

translation.en: It'd be a lot safer.
Safer, sure, but not nearly as exciting.
At least say you'll join me for this fundraiser tomorrow.
translation.ko: 그래도 내일 모금 행사엔 와줄 거지?

translation.en: Do you really need me there? You know I don't like political events.
translation.ko: 꼭 가야 해요? 정치 행사 싫어하는 거 아시잖아요

translation.en: Yes, but I also know you love me.
translation.ko: 네가 이 아빠를 사랑하는 것도 알지

translation.en: Come on, do your dad a favor.
The donors love you.
Besides, I haven't seen your face in ages.
-Dad, we FaceTimed yesterday. -Doesn't count.
translation.ko: - 어제 영상 통화 했잖아요 - 그건 안 쳐

translation.en: All right, all right. I will see you at the fundraiser.
Now get out of the office and stop worrying about me.
-Okay. Good night. -Good night.
Right off the top, we've got Susan's interview with the mayor.
translation.ko: 톱 뉴스 바로 다음엔 수전의 시장 인터뷰로 가지

translation.en: You good to go?
His Honorable has pushed it to 3:00 p.m., but I'll be ready.
Good. Keep digging. Get the story first.
translation.ko: 좋아, 계속 파헤쳐 보도 내용부터 준비해

translation.en: Alex, welcome.
Hi, sorry. Train delay.
Next, we've got a bomb scare at Newark Liberty.
translation.ko: 다음은 뉴어크 공항 폭파 협박 건

translation.en: -Ed, I want you on this one. -Already there.
David, I covered that train derailment last March.
translation.ko: 제가 지난 3월에 열차 탈선 사고 취재했잖아요

translation.en: I stayed in contact with some of my sources at the Department of Transpo.
translation.ko: 그때 알게 된 교통국 취재원이랑 계속 연락하고 있어요

translation.en: -Send them to Ed if you think they'd help. -Great.
I was thinking this could be my assignment.
translation.ko: 그 건은 제가 맡을 줄 알았는데요

translation.en: Forget about it, Kate. Actually, this one's for you.
There was a call from a woman in the South Bronx
saying she found a bag on her porch.
She found a bag? Why aren't we going live to air with this thing right now?
-The bag was full of cash. -Hm. Who does she think it belongs to?
translation.ko: - 가방에 현금이 들어있었대 - 주인이 누군지 안대요?

translation.en: She's convinced it was given to her by a Good Samaritan.
translation.ko: 선한 사마리아인이 자기 준 게 확실하다더군

translation.en: -Aww. -Sounds like a sweet story.
You now, this could be a home run for Lauren.
She's great on soft news. No offense.
-It's what I do. -Lauren's on Ribfest.
translation.ko: - 제 주특기죠 - 로런은 립 페스티벌 맡았어

translation.en: Okay. Well, I can follow up on the warehouse fire.
The fire's out. There's nothing to follow up on.
translation.ko: 불은 꺼졌잖아, 더 나올 것도 없어

translation.en: That's it, people. Get out of here. Go find some news.
David, what are you not telling me?
Execs don't want you on any story that might explode,
translation.ko: 위에서 자네한테 폭발, 붕괴, 화재는 맡기지 말래

translation.en: implode, burst into flames, or otherwise end up in an insurance claim.
translation.ko: 위에서 자네한테 폭발, 붕괴, 화재는 맡기지 말래 자칫하면 보험 문제 터진다고

translation.en: Consider this a break from the bummer beat.
For how long?
We'll see. For now, you're on the Good Samaritan.
translation.ko: 두고 보자고 일단은 선한 사마리아인 맡아

translation.en: [Kate] It's barely news.
A woman finds a bag of money. I mean, what's next?
translation.ko: 한 여자가 돈 가방을 찾았다? 다음은 또 뭘까?

translation.en: A charity car wash? Parent-teacher conference?
translation.ko: 자선 세차 캠페인? 학부모 교사 간담회?

translation.en: David's not gonna keep you on local interest for long.
translation.ko: 지역 뉴스에 오래 묶어두진 않을 거야

translation.en: -You're one of his best reporters. -Thanks.
But still, I mean, where's the story?
What? You don't buy the Good Samaritan angle?
I remain objective always. But no.
translation.ko: 내가 매사에 객관적이긴 해도 그딴 건 안 믿어

translation.en: [woman] Over here!
[Kate] There she is. Hi.
You ready?
Please, come this way.
I will let you in.
It came in this bag, just like this.
Wow.
And, now, does this mean anything to you?
No.
But I know there is someone out there looking over and helping us.
translation.ko: 하지만 누군가 우리를 지켜보며 돕는단 건 알죠

translation.en: This has been a very hard time.
My husband was laid off last winter.
After that, we were evicted and...
we moved here.
Did it come with a note? Anything?
No note.
But I know why it happened.
A miracle.
Si. This is why I called you here. I want everyone to know miracles happen.
translation.ko: 그 때문에 제보했어요 모두에게 기적이 있다는 걸 알리고 싶어서요

translation.en: You don't believe in miracles.
You cannot see everything with your eyes.
Sometimes...
you have to look in here.
You know, it may be feel-good filler, but it does the trick.
translation.ko: 미담 뉴스는 되겠지만 딱히 알아낸 건 없네

translation.en: Thanks. We should upload this segment, though. We go live in 20.
translation.ko: 그래도 업로드해야 해 20분 후에 나갈 거라서

translation.en: You still think it's drug money, don't you?
Or maybe a robbery. I don't know.
translation.ko: 훔친 돈일 수도 있고 나야 모르지

translation.en: Look, I just think it's hard to believe
that there's somebody out there doing good deeds and expecting nothing in return.
translation.ko: 누군가 선행을 베풀기 위해 대가 없이 돈을 줬다?

translation.en: I don't know. That's kind of cynical.
translation.ko: 너무 냉소적이다 그런 일은 자주 있어

translation.en: -I'm sure it happens all the time. -Oh, yeah?
translation.ko: 너무 냉소적이다 그런 일은 자주 있어 진짜? 근데 왜 여태 같이 다니면서

translation.en: Then why, in all of the time we've worked together,
translation.ko: 진짜? 근데 왜 여태 같이 다니면서

translation.en: have we never reported a story like this?
translation.ko: 한 번도 그런 걸 취재한 적이 없을까나?

translation.en: What about that guy last Christmas?
The one that was fixing people's cars in mall parking lots when they broke down.
translation.ko: 어떤 남자가 쇼핑몰 주차장에서 사람들 차 수리해줬잖아

translation.en: That story never aired. You know why, right?
translation.ko: 그 얘기는 결국 방송 못 탔지 왠지 알아?

translation.en: -Because he had that weird toupee? -What? No.
Because the guy disabled the cars to begin with while the owners were shopping
translation.ko: 남자가 차주들이 쇼핑하는 동안 일부러 차를 고장 내고

translation.en: and then offered to fix them for a small donation.
-Seriously? -Yeah.
This number eight...
maybe it's a marketing gimmick.
Do you remember that-- that, um, ride-share company
that handed out ten-dollar bills on Wall Street?
Sure.
That campaign cost them a quarter million dollars.
translation.ko: 회사는 그 마케팅 캠페인에만 25만 달러를 썼어

translation.en: Okay, but that campaign reached 25,000 people.
I mean, what company wants to so badly win over Christina Gomez?
translation.ko: 크리스티나 고메즈 한 명한테 뭐하러 그 돈을 쓰겠어

translation.en: Okay, so maybe not that.
All I'm saying is that whoever's behind this, they have a motive.
translation.ko: 어쨌거나 배후가 누구든 저의가 있을 거야

translation.en: I am certain change can happen because I am a product of it.
translation.ko: 전 변화가 가능하다고 믿습니다 저 역시 변화의 산물이니까요

translation.en: In 1951, my grandfather, Harish Banerjee,
moved his family and his engineering firm to New York City.
translation.ko: 가족과 자신의 엔지니어링 회사를 이끌고 뉴욕으로 이주하셨죠

translation.en: What was Banerjee Electronics in Calcutta
translation.ko: 그 결과 캘커타에 있던 바너지 전자는

translation.en: became Bradley Electronics in Queens.
Harish became Harry, but he remained the same man.
translation.ko: 하리시란 이름도 해리로 바꿨지만 할아버님은 변하지 않았죠

translation.en: A man who came here not just to succeed, but to give back.
translation.ko: 성공하고, 또 그 결과를 돌려주고자 여기 왔다는 걸 잊지 않으셨습니다

translation.en: In these uncertain times,
it is tempting to be cynical, to be fearful,
but together, -we can make change happen. -[applause]
translation.ko: 하지만 우리가 뜻을 함께하면 변화가 일어날 것입니다

translation.en: Thank you.
Inspiring as always, Dad.
But you got dressed in the back of your car again, didn't you?
translation.ko: 옷은 또 차 뒷좌석에서 갈아입으셨나 봐요?

translation.en: -You don't miss a thing, do you? -Uh-uh.
Now, I want you to meet one of my donors. He's, uh-- he's been asking about you.
translation.ko: 가자, 소개해줄 후원자가 있다 전부터 네 얘기를 물었지

translation.en: Seen you on TV.
Don't tell me.
Uh, he probably wants me to do a story on his business.
translation.ko: 자기 사업 얘기를 뉴스에 내달란 거겠죠

translation.en: He already has enough publicity.
He was just named Investment Alliance fund manager of the year.
Oh, so it'll be an hour of me listening to him
translation.ko: 아, 그럼 한 시간 내내 자기가 금융계에서

translation.en: boasting about his financial success.
I don't know why I'd talk about my work when yours is so much more interesting.
translation.ko: 그쪽 얘기가 훨씬 재밌는데 뭐하러 내 얘길 하겠어요

translation.en: [clears throat] Kate, meet, uh, Jack Hansen.
Hi. Hi, Jack.
Pleasure.
I guess this means now I need to ask you about what you do
translation.ko: 제가 속단한 게 아니란 걸 증명하려면

translation.en: to prove I didn't prejudge you.
And I'll pretend to be flattered but steer the conversation back to what you do,
translation.ko: 그럼 좀 우쭐한 척하다가 당신 일 얘기로 돌아가겠죠

translation.en: like, uh, your report on the train derailment.
translation.ko: 열차 탈선 사고 보도 같은 거요

translation.en: I couldn't believe that you got that engineer
translation.ko: 대체 어떻게 했길래 기관사가 운행 중 문자 한 걸 인정하게 만들었죠?

translation.en: to admit that he was texting and driving.
translation.ko: 기관사가 운행 중 문자 한 걸 인정하게 만들었죠?

translation.en: Uh, well, he was not a bright man.
I knew you two would get along.
Do you mind if I leave you in Kate's hands?
Yeah, if it's all right with her.
-Sure. -Thanks, Ashok.
Bye, Dad.
So should we pick out the best spot to watch the political ritual unfold?
translation.ko: 정치 행사의 진면목을 볼 명당자리를 찾아볼까요?

translation.en: Uh, for me, that would be the spot closest to the exit.
So no interest in politics?
Your dad wants you to move to Washington.
Oh, I am well aware, but no.
No way am I leaving New York.
And plus, covering politics is just not my thing.
translation.ko: 정치 뉴스 취재는 적성에도 안 맞고요

translation.en: Why not?
Breaking news is more direct.
It's more honest. At least when people lie, or cheat, or steal...
translation.ko: 더 정직하죠 속이거나 훔치는 사람들이 있어도 대놓고 하거든요

translation.en: ...they're doing it out in the open.
translation.ko: 속이거나 훔치는 사람들이 있어도 대놓고 하거든요

translation.en: -No time to make up a soundbite, huh? -Exactly.
translation.ko: - 멘트 짜깁기 안 해도 되고요? - 맞아요

translation.en: Oh, sorry. Uh...
The station just sent me a lead on a story I'm working on.
translation.ko: 제가 맡은 뉴스 때문에 취재 지시가 떨어졌네요

translation.en: I have to run.
Okay, well, let's exchange numbers. We could do dinner sometime.
translation.ko: 그래요, 번호나 교환하죠 언제 같이 저녁 먹어요

translation.en: Um, I'm flattered, but I have a rule.
I don't go out with anyone in my father's political circle.
translation.ko: 아버지 정치에 관련된 분은 따로 안 만나요

translation.en: Why so?
When you are the daughter of a senator, you never know what people's motives are.
translation.ko: 아버지가 상원의원이다 보면 상대의 의도를 알 수가 없거든요

translation.en: I like to think my motives are pretty clear.
Dinner.
Sala Cucina.
Oh, that's a good restaurant, but sorry, the answer's still no.
translation.ko: 거기 정말 맛있죠 하지만 죄송해요 제 답은 '노'예요 만나서 반가웠어요

translation.en: It was really nice to meet you.
-[sighs] -Hi, is this Marie Ellis? [Marie] Yes.
This is Kate Bradley with Channel 12 News. You called the station?
translation.ko: 채널 12 뉴스 케이트 브래들리예요 연락 주셨다고요?

translation.en: [Marie] I saw your report about the woman who found the cash on her doorstep.
translation.ko: 현관에서 돈을 발견한 여자에 대한 뉴스 봤는데요

translation.en: -I got the same thing. -Really? How much cash was it?
translation.ko: 저도 같은 일이 생겼어요 정말요? 돈은 얼마나 있었죠?

translation.en: $100,000. In the bag with the tilted number eight.
translation.ko: 숫자 8이 비스듬히 쓰인 가방에 10만 달러가 들어있었어요

translation.en: Okay, where can I meet you?
I'll text you my address.
But if you bring a camera, I won't open my door.
translation.ko: 카메라는 안 돼요 그럼 만날 수 없어요

translation.en: Got it. I'm on my way right now.
[Marie] It's real.
Not counterfeit.
I found it in front of our door this morning.
Same bag and everything.
I thought it might be stolen, so I took it to the police, but...
they say it doesn't appear to be.
Who do you think could be behind this?
I don't know. I'm hoping you might tell me.
I'm sorry, I have no idea.
Look, I know the woman you interviewed thinks it's a Good Samaritan.
translation.ko: 전에 인터뷰한 여자는 선한 사마리아인이라고 하던데

translation.en: But we don't exactly need the help.
I'm an oncologist at Parkland Hospital.
So what are you planning on doing with the money?
Pancreatic cancer research.
All of it?

News conference at ten to detail the manhunt.

translation.en: -[Kate] How do you plan to spend it? -I'm gonna pay off my debts,

Security cameras at this Upper West Side building
translation.ko: 오늘 이곳 어퍼웨스트사이드의 건물 보안 카메라에

translation.en: captured a glimpse of the mysterious donor today

translation.ko: 기증자는 목수인 제시 더럼에게 3번째 현금 가방을 전했는데요

translation.en: just hours after a second bag was left at the home of a Brooklyn resident,
translation.ko: 익명을 원하는 브루클린 주민에게 2번째 가방을 남긴 지

translation.en: who wishes to remain anonymous.
Who is this Good Samaritan who has now given away $300,000?

Kate Bradley, Channel 12 News.

Jack Hansen.

Interest in Good Sam continues to grow,
translation.ko: 굿 샘에 대한 관심이 커지며 "뉴요커가 굿 샘에게 말하다 #굿샘뉴욕"

translation.en: in response to our reporting,
