translation.ko: 굿 샘의 신원에 대해선 아직 어떤 단서도 없습니다

translation.en: The question at the top of every New Yorker's mind,
Good Sam, who are you?
Any new leads on Good Sam's identity? Oh, how'd that Realtor thing work out?
translation.ko: 굿 샘의 정체에 대해 건진 거 없나? 그 부동산 중개업자는 어찌 됐지?

translation.en: Dead end, just like everything else. We know who he's not.
translation.ko: 굿 샘이 아니란 거 말고는 더 알아낸 게 없어요

translation.en: Yeah, we spoke to a bunch of charities and foundations.
They all said that no reasonable non-profit would ever operate this way.
translation.ko: 정상적인 비영리 단체는 이런 식으로 운영하지 않는대요

translation.en: -We even called an FBI profiler. -Any insights?
Just that we have no idea who Good Sam is.
Look, he might seem like Santa Claus or some other benevolent figure,
translation.ko: 다만 산타클로스같이 인정 많은 사람처럼 보여도

translation.en: but the profiler said it's just as likely
that something darker, even dangerous, is motivating this.
translation.ko: 의외로 사악하고 위험한 의도가 있을 수도 있대요

translation.en: Kate, there's a man here asking for you.
He says he's Good Sam.
What-- What does he look like?
Mid-thirties, maybe six foot-ish.
Matches Jesse Durham's security footage.
Um... yeah, tell him I'll be right there.
So, Tyler, is It? Good Sam.
Uh-huh.
Uh, tell me how you got all this money to give away.
I built an app for this little company and it got sold to a giant company.
translation.ko: 작은 회사를 위해 개발한 앱을 대기업에 팔았어요

translation.en: Mm-hmm.
And, um, why are you doing all this?
I wanted to do an anonymous social experiment for good.
translation.ko: 익명으로 하는 선행에 대한 사회적 실험을 하고 싶었죠

translation.en: To share my wealth with random strangers.
translation.ko: 모르는 사람들과 제 부를 공유하는 거요

translation.en: Isn't that what we should all be doing?
Sure, yeah.
And, um, how did you choose your recipients?
I wrote some code
that would randomly select residential addresses in New York City.
translation.ko: 뉴욕시에 있는 주소를 무작위로 뽑는 프로그램요

translation.en: Ah. And why this way, though?
You know, leaving $100,000 on people's doorsteps.
translation.ko: 사람들 집 앞에 10만 달러를 두고 가는 거요

translation.en: I found it was a creative way to do it.
It is, isn't it?
Are we doing the interview in there, at the-- the news desk?
-Uh, I need to collect some facts first. -Because everybody knows I'm him.
translation.ko: 사전에 파악해야 할 것들이... 다들 저인 걸 아나 봐요

translation.en: I mean, that's-- that's why they're all looking at me.
A few days ago, you left $100,000 for a woman so she could go to law school.
translation.ko: 며칠 전 한 여성에게 10만 달러를 전달하셨죠 로스쿨 등록금으로 쓰라면서요

translation.en: What was her first name again?
I... Sorry, I-- I can't remember every detail.
translation.ko: 미안해요, 그런 것까지 다 기억하진 못해요

translation.en: It's okay. Take a moment.
I never mentioned her name in any of my reports,
translation.ko: 전 뉴스에서 전혀 이름을 언급 안 했어요

translation.en: so you'd be the only one to know.
Remind me, what is her name?
Is it, um, Elizabeth Haywood? Is that it?
Yeah, that's it.
That's-- That's her name. I remember now.
Her name was Faith.
How could you forget someone's name who you just gave $100,000?
translation.ko: 며칠 전에 10만 달러를 줬는데 어떻게 이름도 기억을 못 하죠?

translation.en: I think this Good Sam is inspiring hope.
translation.ko: 굿 샘이 사람들에게 희망을 주는 것 같다

translation.en: Times like these, people need it.
I just keep wondering what he hopes to gain by all this.
translation.ko: 그 사람은 뭘 바라고 이런 일을 할까요?

translation.en: Well, is it possible that he doesn't expect anything?
translation.ko: 바라는 게 없을 수도 있지 않니?

translation.en: That's pretty unlikely.
The problem is he stopped giving.
I mean, biggest story of my career and it looks like it might be over.
translation.ko: 제 인생 최대의 특종이 끝나버린 거 같아요

translation.en: Not one single money drop yesterday.
I have a feeling you'll find a way to keep it going.
Thanks, Dad.
Any chance you'll come with me to the mayor's house tonight?
translation.ko: 혹시 오늘 밤에 같이 시장 관저에 가지 않으련?

translation.en: I know, I know. You can't stand political events, but...
translation.ko: 아무렴, 네가 정치 행사라면 질색하는 거 안다만

translation.en: you seemed to enjoy the last one.
The last one was not awful, I'll admit. Yeah.
Could it be because of Jack Hansen?
Our brief conversation wasn't dull.
translation.ko: 잠깐 얘기한 게 다지만 지루하진 않았죠

translation.en: You shouldn't hold the fact that he's one of my donors against him.
translation.ko: 그 사람이 내 후원자란 거 너무 신경 쓰지 말려무나

translation.en: He's a... He's a smart guy.
A lot of smart guys in New York, Dad.
And ambitious, like you are.
And when you're not busy chasing news stories, you...
might like to get to know him better.
We'll see.
So, Christina, a week ago, you received $100,000 from an anonymous donor.
translation.ko: 크리스티나, 1주일 전 익명의 후원자에게 10만 달러를 받으셨죠

translation.en: Can you tell us what's happened since then?
I would say that Good Sam changed my life forever.
translation.ko: 굿 샘이 제 인생을 완전히 바꿔놨어요

translation.en: And not just because I'm able to take care of my family
translation.ko: 단순히 식구들을 챙길 수 있게 되고

translation.en: and buy a few new things,
but because of how he changed me.
And how's that?
He made me see that I could help others.
translation.ko: 나도 남을 도울 수 있단 걸 알려줬어요

translation.en: Like my neighbor. You know?
She takes three buses to get to her job.
translation.ko: 이웃 여자는 출근하려면 버스를 3번이나 타야 해요

translation.en: So, I decided why don't I help her like Good Sam helped me?
translation.ko: 그래서 굿 샘이 나를 도왔듯 나도 남을 돕기로 했죠

translation.en: So I went out and I bought her a car.
You bought her a car?
I gave it to her this morning.
Her whole family cried.
And me...
I've never been happier about anything I've done.
translation.ko: 여태 뭘 해서 그만큼 행복한 적이 없었어요

translation.en: So getting this gift from Good Sam -inspired you to give to someone else? -Mm-hmm.
translation.ko: 굿 샘의 선물에 감화받아 다른 사람을 도왔단 말인가요?

translation.en: It's spreading.
Like miracles do.
I can't believe Christina used her money to buy a car for a stranger.
translation.ko: 크리스티나가 남한테 차를 사줬대서 깜짝 놀랐어

translation.en: Yeah. And that Marie gave all her stash to some charity?
Yeah. To pancreatic cancer research at her hospital.
translation.ko: 응, 자기 병원 췌장암 연구소에 줬대

translation.en: She texted me.
Apparently, their donations have tripled since we mentioned it in the news.
It's like Good Sam's generosity is contagious.
Here we go.
Hey, David. We're headed back right now.
-[David] Are you still in the Bronx? -Yeah, why?
Police scanner said there's a construction worker
dangling off the side of the Hope Watson building.
Your van's the closest.
-Can you be live in three? -Three minutes?
It's a news van, not a time machine.
I heard that, Josh. I want eyeballs on this one.
translation.ko: 다 들려, 조시 이 건 철저하게 취재해

translation.en: The fire department can't reach him with ladders,
so they're gonna send someone from the roof.
My FDNY source says it's the rescue one team from station 72.
[Kate] 72? Who's the rescuer?
Uh, Eric Hayes, but don't say his name on the air.
translation.ko: 에릭 헤이스 방송에선 이름 말하지 마

translation.en: -Looks like we're first on the scene. -[David] Great.
-Calling my guy at the fire station. -David, are you seeing this?
translation.ko: - 소방국 취재원 연결 중이야 - 지금 화면 보여요?

translation.en: We're gonna go live in ten seconds. Stand by, Kate.
Keep your phone up, and I'll feed you info as it comes in.
translation.ko: 소식 들어오는 대로 전할 테니 전화 끊지 마

translation.en: In five, four, three...
[Kate] We are live in the Bronx
where a construction worker repairing brickwork
translation.ko: "브롱크스 건물 발판 붕괴 인부 구조 작업 중"

translation.en: now finds himself trapped, hanging over a hundred feet above ground.
translation.ko: 건물 외벽을 보수 중이던 인부가 지상 30m 높이에 고립됐습니다

translation.en: FDNY are attempting a daring rescue here,
translation.ko: 뉴욕 소방국이 현장에서 과감한 구조 작업 중으로

translation.en: sending a lone firefighter rappelling down the side of the building.
translation.ko: 소방대원 한 명이 외벽을 따라 하강하고 있습니다

translation.en: The worker is trying to--
-[gasps] Oh! Uh... -[crowd clamoring]
The worker has slipped.
He is now clinging to the edge of his scaffolding,
surely panicked it won't hold his weight much longer.
translation.ko: 매우 당황한 상태로 오래 버티지 못할 듯합니다

translation.en: Okay, it looks like the rescuer's got him.
He's attaching him to his harness.
And it looks like they're okay.
Another astonishing rescue from our heroes at the FDNY.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 소방국의 영웅이 오늘도 놀라운 구조에 성공합니다

translation.en: Big sighs of relief here in the South Bronx.
translation.ko: 이곳 사우스브롱크스엔 안도의 한숨 소리가 들립니다

translation.en: Go to a stand-up wrap-up, and get me an interview for the six o'clock cast.
translation.ko: 이제 스탠드업으로 마무리하고 6시 뉴스에 낼 인터뷰 따

translation.en: A perilous situation, a dangerous rescue.
translation.ko: 아찔한 위기 상황과 위험한 구조 작업 후 "사우스브롱크스의 대담한 구조 작전"

translation.en: A New York City construction worker will go home safe to his family,
translation.ko: 뉴욕의 공사장 인부는 무사히 가족 품으로 돌아가게 됐습니다

translation.en: thanks to a hero at the FDNY.
Reporting live from the Bronx, I'm Kate Bradley, Channel 12 News.
translation.ko: 이상 브롱크스 현장 중계를 마칩니다 채널 12 뉴스의 케이트 브래들리였습니다

translation.en: -[Josh] He said he doesn't do interviews. -[Kate] Sit tight till I talk him into it.
translation.ko: - 인터뷰 안 한다고 했다며 - 하게 만들 테니 있어 봐

translation.en: Um, excuse me.
I'm looking for Eric Hayes.
Could you let him know that Kate from Channel 12 News is here, please?
Yeah.
Hayes is in, but he's not talking to reporters.
translation.ko: 헤이스가 있긴 한데 기자랑은 말 안 해요

translation.en: -Oh-- -Hey, George, it's all good.
Thanks.
Hi.
-I was at the construction worker rescue. -Again?
-We've gotta stop meeting like this. -[laughs]
I'm really glad you're okay.
Yeah. Looks more impressive than it is.
You know, we're pretty well-trained.
Yeah, but it must be hard putting your life on the line every day.
translation.ko: 그래도 매일 생명의 위험을 감수하는 건 힘든 일이잖아요

translation.en: I like knowing I'm making things better, you know.
translation.ko: 상황을 낫게 만드는 일을 하는 게 좋아요

translation.en: See, that's exactly why you should do an interview.
Look, I cover the bummer beat every single day.
Sorry, the what?
You know, um, disaster, murder, violence, the things that go wrong.
translation.ko: 재난, 살인, 폭력 같은 나쁜 소식을 보도하잖아요

translation.en: But today, I watched you take something that had gone horribly wrong...
translation.ko: 하지만 오늘은 끔찍하게 끝날 뻔한 일을

translation.en: and you made it right.
And when that happens...
viewers need to see that.
I feel like you can talk anyone into an interview.
translation.ko: 세상에 인터뷰 못 시킬 사람이 없겠어요

translation.en: Just not today. You're not gonna convince me.
translation.ko: 하지만 오늘은 아녜요 난 안 넘어가요

translation.en: Well, can I ask why?
You ask a lot of questions.
Well, I am a reporter. It's kind of what we do.
We can't all be heroes like you, you know.
translation.ko: 전부 당신 같은 영웅이 되진 못해요

translation.en: I'm not a hero. I'm just doing my job.
translation.ko: 영웅 아니에요 주어진 일을 할 뿐이죠

translation.en: You know, I'm at work right now, just like you.
Right.
So, really, no interview?
My editor's gonna kill me.
No.
But maybe we should do this again sometime,
you know, without the emergency vehicles.
-Um, yeah. Yeah, I'd like that. -[cell phone vibrates and chimes]
Oh, sorry. Yeah?
Central Park? I got Sunday off.
-Yeah. Yeah, Sunday-- Sunday works great. -[cell phone chimes]
I'm so sorry, I have to go. This is my editor.
Apparently Good Sam is giving away money again.
-Really? Where? -Uh...
Sunnyside and Lenox Hill.
You really can't be Good Sam, can you?
-I've had eyes on you all day. -[phone chimes] Okay, I gotta go.
I'll see you on Sunday.
-[Eric] I'll text you. -Great.
Hey, Lauren said that you--
-What's going on? -[sighs]
We got scooped.
-What? -Yeah.
That woman in Sunnyside who found a hundred grand...
Channel 3 just reported it an hour ago.
-You're kidding. -Mm-hmm.
The family in Lenox Hill...
Channel 9 just reported that on their six o'clock cast.
-But you sent me to that building rescue. -No, no.
translation.ko: 하지만 국장님이 절 구조 현장에 보냈잖아요 그렇지 않아

translation.en: The news sent you.
And you knocked it out of the park.
Kate...
you were meant for the bummer beat.
That's your thing.
Fires, car crashes, Black Friday riots at the mall.
translation.ko: 화재, 교통사고, 쇼핑몰의 블랙 프라이데이 폭동 같은 거

translation.en: This Good Sam story, not so much.
Is this supposed to be some kind of pep talk, 'cause I'm not--
translation.ko: 혹시 저 위로할 일 있어요? 전 그럴...

translation.en: Management wants a bigger name on this.
They want Susan.
On my story?
Come on, Kate. You know how this works.
Every other station has their most senior reporter on it,
translation.ko: 모든 방송국이 이 건을 최고참한테 맡기고 있어

translation.en: and Susan does have 15 years' experience--
And an Emmy Award. I know. I get it.
But I'm the one that broke this story, remember?
Please just give me some more time. I will find Good Sam.
translation.ko: 시간을 주시면 굿 샘이 누군지 밝힐게요

translation.en: It's a done deal.
Susan's out covering the latest drop-offs.
translation.ko: 수전이 마지막 기부 건 취재하러 갔어

translation.en: [David] Look...
Send her your notes.
I've got you at 10:00 a.m. in Queens, covering the garbage strike deadline.
translation.ko: 오전 10시엔 퀸스에서 쓰레기 수거 업체 파업 보도해

translation.en: Garbage strike.
Wow.
It'll be an easy day. You could use it.
Yeah, okay.
Kate...
There's a bigger story out there for you.
translation.ko: 나중에 더 큰 건이 있을 거야

translation.en: Damn it.
Good Sam struck again today.
New York City's mysterious philanthropist left $100,000 cash
translation.ko: "굿 샘, 퀸스에 또 10만 달러 쾌척 행운의 7번째는 헌터스포인트로" 뉴욕의 신비한 자선가는 퀸스의 운 좋은 가족 현관에

translation.en: on a lucky family's doorstep in Queens.
translation.ko: 뉴욕의 신비한 자선가는 퀸스의 운 좋은 가족 현관에 10만 달러를 두고 갔는데요

translation.en: This is the seventh gift from New York City's Good Sam.
translation.ko: 이번은 뉴욕의 굿 샘이 한 7번째 기부입니다

translation.en: [Josh] Do we have to listen to Susan's report on our story?
translation.ko: 맙소사, 우리 뉴스를 수전한테 들어야 해?

translation.en: -It's killing me. -I know.
From Hunters Point, Queens, I'm Susan Andrews...
Wait, Hunters Point?
-What's up? -Well...
the first four Good Sam gifts were left all over the city, but...
translation.ko: 굿 샘이 처음 한 4건은 전부 도시 여기저기였잖아

translation.en: Look.
These last three were close together.
David took you off Good Sam.
I'm allowed to be curious.
Consider this my new hobby.
What is it?
Just a text message from someone claiming to be Good Sam.
translation.ko: 자기가 굿 샘이란 사람이 문자를 보냈어

translation.en: What's it say?
Seriously? I'm sure it's just another fake.
translation.ko: - 뭐라는데? - 알 게 뭐야 그래 봤자 또 뻥이겠지

translation.en: "Dear Kate, I want to set the record straight about who I am
and why I've been giving away substantial sums of money."
Scooch.
"I'm willing to reveal myself to you, and only you,
a reporter I know I can trust."
I mean, we've heard this before.
Lots of guys out there claiming to be Good Sam.
"If you'd like proof that I'm Good Sam,
go see John Baylor at 225 Watson in Astoria.
I left $100,000 on his front porch an hour ago."
translation.ko: '1시간 전에 그 사람 현관에 10만 달러를 두고 왔어요'

translation.en: Okay, but seriously, I'm sure reporters all over the city got this text.
translation.ko: 온 뉴욕 기자들이 다 이 문자 받았을걸?

translation.en: Yeah, sounds pretty spammy to me too,
but Watson Street in Astoria is right near Hunters Point.
translation.ko: 근데 애스토리아의 왓슨가는 헌터스포인트 바로 옆이거든

translation.en: -Is it? -Mm-hmm.
You know what? You're right. It is.
So then, what are we waiting for?
Let's go see what's on John Baylor's front porch.
-Which one did you say it is? -I think it's across there.
[Josh] So you're really sure about this, huh?
-I just have a hunch. -A hunch that we're gonna get murdered?
It's broad daylight. What's the worst that could happen? -Famous last words. -[laughs]
translation.ko: - 대낮인데 무슨 일이야 있겠어? - 죽으면 그 말 오래 기억되겠어

translation.en: Hi. John Baylor?
Yeah.
I'm from Channel 12 News.
Yeah, I know who you are.
You're the second surprise to show up on my front porch today.
By that, do you mean you also found a bag with a stack of cash in it?
translation.ko: 그 말은 돈다발이 든 가방을 찾으셨단 뜻인가요?

translation.en: Yeah, it was--
Wait, how did you know? I just got home 20 minutes ago.
translation.ko: 네, 근데 어떻게 알았죠? 20분 전에 집에 왔거든요

translation.en: We, um...
We're just that good. [laughs]
Would you be willing to do an interview for the news?
Yeah, but you'll want to talk to Sylvia.
Sylvia!
She's the reason why Good Sam chose us.
translation.ko: 실비아 덕에 굿 샘이 저희를 선택했죠

translation.en: -Honey. -Hi.
Hi, how are you?
I'm good. And you?
-Good, thanks. -Would you guys like to come in?
Oh, yeah, thank you.
[John] Right this way.
[John] My wife is really sick.
There's a treatment, but, um, our insurance doesn't cover it.
translation.ko: 치료법이 있지만 보험 처리가 안 됐죠

translation.en: So, my daughter, she said, "Daddy, can we make a video for Good Sam?"
translation.ko: 근데 딸애가 굿 샘한테 영상 편지를 보내자더군요

translation.en: And Sylvia, why did you decide you wanted to send a message to Good Sam?
translation.ko: 실비아, 왜 굿 샘한테 영상 편지를 보냈지?

translation.en: [Sylvia] I wanted him to help my mommy.
[John] Then I made a video on my phone, and we posted it on the Channel 12 site.
translation.ko: 제가 폰으로 동영상을 찍고 채널 12 홈페이지에 올렸죠

translation.en: Yeah, and I was on the news just like you.
[Kate] That's right. You were.
If Good Sam were watching right now, what would you like to say to him?
translation.ko: 굿 샘이 지금 보고 있다면 무슨 말을 하시겠어요?

translation.en: Good Sam...
you're giving us back some hope...
some plans for our future, when...
we really thought we were out of both.
Thank you.
Thank you, Good Sam.
We had to make sure the lead was legit before we brought it to you.
translation.ko: 보고하기 전에 문자가 사실인지 확인하러 간 거예요

translation.en: You're gonna run it, right? I mean, that kid. Like, come on.
It's good, all right? It's good.
But this is Susan's story, and this is not gonna go over well with station management.
translation.ko: 하지만 이젠 수전 담당이라 경영진이 가만 안 있을 거야

translation.en: David, we are the only station that has this story, for now.
translation.ko: 데이비드, 이걸 취재한 방송국은 지금 우리밖에 없어요

translation.en: All right, fine. I'll run it.
But in case I wasn't clear before,
you get any more leads, you bring them to her.
translation.ko: 앞으로 뭐 알게 되면 수전한테 넘겨

translation.en: -Okay, but what if Good Sam doesn't-- -[David] Kate, Kate...
Kate, please, just-- just do what I ask you. For once?
translation.ko: 제발 한 번이라도 내가 시키는 대로 해

translation.en: What are you looking at?
He's fun.
-It was good. -It was good. It was very good.
My dad and I actually raced a boat here once. We took seventh place.
translation.ko: 여기서 아빠랑 보트경주 한 적 있어요, 7등으로 들어왔죠

translation.en: No kidding. I probably saw you there.
When my brother and I weren't out sailing with my dad, we were here racing boats.
translation.ko: 패트릭이랑 아버지랑 배 타러 안 나갈 땐 여기서 보트경주 했거든요

translation.en: We built our own models every winter to race the next summer.
translation.ko: 겨울마다 다음 여름 경주에 내보낼 배를 직접 만들었죠

translation.en: -Wait, you built them? -Yeah.
Fancy.
Do you still sail?
Ah, no, not anymore.
Um, so, tell me about kid Eric.
Was he as obsessed with fire trucks as he was boats?
Well, yeah. Every kid dreams of being a firefighter.
translation.ko: 원래 어릴 때는 다들 소방관이 꿈이잖아요

translation.en: I'm just one of the lucky grown-ups who got to be.
translation.ko: 꿈을 이뤘으니 난 운 좋은 어른이죠

translation.en: I'm not sure everyone would describe a job
where you have to risk your life daily to save strangers as "lucky."
translation.ko: 날마다 남들을 위해 목숨을 거는 게 운 좋은 건 아니죠

translation.en: All right. Maybe not lucky, then.
Useful... works. I like knowing that I'm useful.
translation.ko: 쓸모있는 일이라고 하죠 내가 쓸모있는 게 좋아요

translation.en: That and the ability to cook at work.
Kid Eric also loved his toy kitchen.
-Oh, really? -Yeah.
Nice.
I mean, if you're free sometime this week, I'd love to cook you dinner.
translation.ko: 그러니까 시간 되면 이번 주에 저녁 만들어줄게요

translation.en: A home-cooked meal? I will not say no to that.
translation.ko: 손수 만들어준다고요? 절대 사양 안 할래요

translation.en: -[cell phone chimes] -Ooh, sorry.
Everything okay?
Yeah, sorry. Um, it's just another text from Good Sam.
translation.ko: 미안해요, 굿 샘이 또 문자를 보냈네요

translation.en: Another text?
Yeah, he texted me yesterday with an address
translation.ko: 어제도 보냈거든요 애스토리아에 돈 남긴 집 주소랑 같이요

translation.en: for the money that he left for a family in Astoria.
translation.ko: 애스토리아에 돈 남긴 집 주소랑 같이요

translation.en: You didn't go, did you?
Josh and I went. And the lead panned out. The money was there and everything.
translation.ko: 조시랑 갔어요 문자 그대로였어요 돈도 진짜 거기 있었고요

translation.en: What does this one say?
Uh, "Now that you know I'm Good Sam,
meet me at nine tonight on level 5A of the parking lot at Center and White.
Come alone and don't bring cameras."
Why would he want a reporter to come alone without cameras?
translation.ko: 방송 기자한테 왜 카메라 없이 오라고 한대요?

translation.en: Oh, I have met sources in some pretty sketchy places, trust me.
translation.ko: 이보다 오싹한 데서 만나자는 취재원도 숱하게 봤답니다

translation.en: Yeah, but still, somebody who gives away this kind of money
would either want to keep it completely quiet
or meet you someplace safe for a proper interview.
I-I don't know, I don't trust this guy. I wouldn't go if I were you.
translation.ko: 아무래도 수상한 놈 같아요 나라면 안 가겠어요

translation.en: But he's my story. I have to know who he is.
translation.ko: 제 뉴스의 주인공인걸요? 누군지 알아야 해요

translation.en: And plus, he's changing things. I mean, he's making people want to help others.
translation.ko: 또 긍정적인 변화를 주고 있어요 사람들이 남을 돕게 만들죠

translation.en: All right. If you insist on meeting this Good Sam...
translation.ko: 굳이 이 굿 샘을 만나야 한다면

translation.en: at least let me come with you.
Thanks, but I'll be fine.
Come on, let me do this.
He won't know, but I'll be there, making sure you're safe.
translation.ko: 그 사람 모르게 당신이 안전한지만 볼게요

translation.en: Okay.
-[Eric] You all right? -[sighs]
Hey.
[Eric] I'm here. I haven't taken my eyes off you for the past ten minutes.
Um, I'm really glad you're here, wherever that is.
Look, don't worry, Kate. I won't let anything happen to you.
translation.ko: 걱정하지 마요, 케이트 아무 일 없도록 할게요

translation.en: Thanks.
Uh... he's late.
I'm worried he's not gonna show at all.
translation.ko: 아예 안 오는 거 아닌지 걱정돼요

translation.en: -Oh, hey, I think that's him. I gotta go. -Okay.
Jack?
Good Sam.
-Sorry I'm late. -Wait, you're Good Sam?
Why didn't you just come out and tell me?
I can-- I can explain everything, just not here.
translation.ko: 다 설명할게요 여기는 좀 그렇고 다른 데로 갈까요?

translation.en: -Can we go talk somewhere else? -Sure.
translation.ko: 여기는 좀 그렇고 다른 데로 갈까요? 좋아요

translation.en: -Hey! Is everything okay? -What the hell do you think you're doing?
[Kate] Oh, it's okay. Jack, this is Eric Hayes.
Kate, I asked you to come alone.
Are you Good Sam?
All you need to know is that she's completely safe with me.
translation.ko: 그쪽이 알 바 아니고 케이트도 걱정하지 마요

translation.en: It's okay. Jack's a friend of my dad's. I know him.
translation.ko: 괜찮아요, 잭은 아빠 지인이에요 전에도 만났죠

translation.en: All right, we gotta go. We're blocking this guy, so...
I'll call you.
Eight's always been my lucky number,
and on the eighth of this month, I made $800,000 on an investment.
Even I wasn't expecting it.
So I figured if it just fell into my lap,
why not someone else's?
And how did you choose the people you wanted to help?
Like Christina Gomez.
I just kept my ears open.
My assistant goes to church with Christina,
and then I saw Sylvia Baylor's video on your report.
translation.ko: 실비아 베일러 영상은 당신 뉴스에서 봤고요

translation.en: But why all the secrecy?
I mean, why not just give them the money and tell them who it's from?
I didn't want the attention.
You know, that's why I hired someone to drop off the money.
translation.ko: 그래서 다른 사람을 시켜 돈을 갖다 줬고요

translation.en: And what about the text messages to me?
When I saw that they gave Susan Andrews your Good Sam story,
translation.ko: 당신의 굿 샘 뉴스가 수전 앤드루스에게 가는 걸 보고

translation.en: I thought if I got in touch with you directly,
then you could get your story back.
But now everyone's talking about Good Sam, and I keep expecting a reporter to...
translation.ko: 이제 다들 굿 샘 때문에 난리고 기자들이 불시에 카메라맨과

translation.en: burst into my office with a camera crew.
I'm in way over my head here, Kate.
I'm-- I'm kind of hoping that you can help me figure out...
what to do next.
I think what you should do next is try to get ahead of the story.
translation.ko: 내 생각엔 당신이 뉴스를 주도하는 게 좋겠어요

translation.en: You should let me interview you.
No.
No, I really don't want to be a story.
Look, if you go public and tell people why you did this,
translation.ko: 신분을 공개하고 왜 그런 일을 했는지 말하면

translation.en: the story can go back to being about helping people,
translation.ko: 관심은 다시 남을 돕는 얘기로 돌아갈 거예요

translation.en: instead of this mystery around who is Good Sam.
translation.ko: 굿 샘의 미스터리를 밝히는 데 연연하는 대신에요

translation.en: You really think that'll help?
I do.
And I think it'll inspire people.
Okay.
Okay. -I trust you. -[laughs]
Okay, great.
I'll need proof, of course.
Copies of the statements of the windfall you're talking about, withdrawals--
translation.ko: 아까 말한 횡재라든가 현금 인출 내역을 증빙할 서류요

translation.en: Yeah, I'll, uh, email you everything tonight.
Great.
I know who Good Sam is.
-Go on. -His name is Jack Hansen.
He runs a hedge fund called Northern Lights Investments.
translation.ko: 노던 라이츠 인베스트먼트란 헤지펀드 회사를 운영하죠

translation.en: He made about $800,000 last month
translation.ko: 지난달 주식 거래로 아무도 예상 못 했던

translation.en: on a stock deal no one else thought to make.
Says he decided to give it away.
Got any solid evidence?
He's the one that gave me the tip about the money being at John Baylor's house.
translation.ko: 존 베일러 집에 돈이 있다고 제보한 사람이에요

translation.en: -Okay, but does that prove it's him? -No, but this might.
translation.ko: 그게 증거가 돼? 그건 아니고 이게 증거죠

translation.en: His financial records.
Look here.
The day before this all started, before Christina Gomez found the money,
translation.ko: 모든 게 시작하기 전 크리스티나 고메즈가 돈을 발견하기 전날

translation.en: Jack Hansen withdrew $400,000 from his account, all at once.
translation.ko: 잭 핸슨은 자기 계좌에서 한 번에 40만 달러를 인출했죠

translation.en: Then here, again, the day before the fifth bag appears,
Hansen withdraws another $400,000.
I mean, that's gotta be more than just a coincidence.
That's what you said about the dead Realtor.
Okay, but this time I'm sure I'm right.
David, he wants to give me an exclusive interview.
Any evidence you didn't get from Hansen himself
that you can corroborate with another source?
Other than the Baylor tip, no,
but if we wait, he could take the story elsewhere.
translation.ko: 꾸물대면 핸슨이 다른 매체로 갈지 몰라요

translation.en: Say yes and I will sit down with Hansen right away.
I can't do it.
Station management will come down on me hard
translation.ko: 이런 특종을 수전이 아닌 너한테 줬다간

translation.en: if I go with you and not Susan for something this big.
You know what? This story is not just about Jack Hansen.
translation.ko: 이건 잭 핸슨 개인에 국한된 인터뷰가 아니에요

translation.en: This story is about how Channel 12 was the first station to find Good Sam,
translation.ko: 모두가 찾아 헤매던 굿 샘의 정체를 최초로 밝혀낸 방송국이 채널 12라는 걸 알리는 인터뷰죠

translation.en: a man that everyone has been looking for.
translation.ko: 최초로 밝혀낸 방송국이 채널 12라는 걸 알리는 인터뷰죠

translation.en: And I am the only one that can tell that story.
Jack, what inspired you to do this?
translation.ko: 잭, 어떤 계기로 이 일을 시작했죠?

translation.en: I wanted to help the workers.
Regular people who work two jobs to put a roof over their families' heads,
translation.ko: 가족이 살 곳을 마련하기 위해 일을 두 개씩 하는 평범한 사람들

translation.en: who pay taxes while living paycheck to paycheck.
They're working longer and harder these days and...
translation.ko: 최근 들어 더 오랜 시간을 더 힘들게 일해야 하는 분들을

translation.en: they should not be forgotten.
So why come forward now?
Um, many people were claiming to be me.
I just wanted to set the record straight about what I wanted to accomplish.
translation.ko: 제가 이루고자 했던 것들에 대한 오해를 바로잡고 싶었어요

translation.en: And what is that?
I wanted to lend a hand in the best way that I could...
translation.ko: "헤지펀드 매니저 잭 핸슨 내가 바로 굿 샘" 제가 할 수 있는 최선의 방법으로 돕고 싶었어요

translation.en: to...
translation.ko: 제가 할 수 있는 최선의 방법으로 돕고 싶었어요

translation.en: the soldiers in our everyday lives.
The people who keep our factories open, who teach our kids in school.
translation.ko: 우리의 공장을 돌아가게 하고 학교에서 우리 아이들을 가르치는 분들요

translation.en: Without those people...
our city could not function.
And they deserve our support.
translation.ko: 그분들은 우리 도움을 받을 자격이 있어요

translation.en: Thank you, Jack.
I've been speaking with Jack Hansen,
translation.ko: "굿 샘 독점 인터뷰" 잭 핸슨을 만나봤습니다

translation.en: Manhattan hedge fund manager who says he's Good Sam,
translation.ko: 맨해튼의 헤지펀드 매니저인 핸슨은 자신이 굿 샘이며

translation.en: the man behind the anonymous cash gifts being left on New York City doorsteps.
translation.ko: 그간 익명으로 뉴욕 시민의 현관에 현금 선물을 전했다고 밝혔습니다

translation.en: Over to you, Chuck.
[woman] And we're out.
So did you get, uh, everything you wanted?
Oh, yeah. You couldn't have been better.
translation.ko: 그럼요, 더 바랄 나위 없이 잘해줬어요

translation.en: So I just got off the phone with the network,
and they want a special report for their national broadcast.
translation.ko: 전국 방송 뉴스에 특별 리포트로 넣겠다는군

translation.en: The story's going national tonight?
Yep. Uh, you better lay low
because, come six o'clock tonight, you're gonna be a very famous man.
translation.ko: 오늘 저녁 6시 후엔 엄청나게 유명해질 테니까요

translation.en: Ah, I'll make sure to enjoy my remaining anonymity.
translation.ko: 얼마 안 남은 무명 상태를 즐겨야겠네요

translation.en: This is a great thing you're doing here, Jack.
Thank you.
Wow. Uh, okay. I'm not ready for this day to be over.
What do you think about grabbing something to eat?
Sure. But you should keep a low profile tonight, like David said.
translation.ko: 좋죠, 근데 데이비드 말대로 조심해서 다니는 게 좋겠어요

translation.en: Do you know anywhere kind of out of the spotlight?
I know just the place.
-Great. -[elevator bell dings]
Oh, wow.
Our interview aired 15 minutes ago and we're already over 10,000 hits.
translation.ko: 인터뷰 나간 지 15분 만에 조회 수 1만을 돌파했어요

translation.en: Are you surprised?
-You're a great interviewer. -Thanks.
Okay, ready for the best Mexican food in Manhattan?
translation.ko: 이제 맨해튼 최고의 멕시코 요리를 먹어볼까요?

translation.en: Yes, I am.
Oh, shoot. Channel 9's here. We should go.
translation.ko: 못 살아, 채널 9에서 나왔어요 얼른 가요

translation.en: -We should go out the back. -Jack Hansen! Good Sam!
translation.ko: - 뒤쪽으로 나가요 - 잭 핸슨 씨, 굿 샘!

translation.en: Who are you gonna give the money to next?
Um... I'm gonna make this brief. I want to help the workers.
Uh, regular people who work two jobs to put a roof over their families' heads,
translation.ko: 가족이 살 곳을 마련하고자 일을 두 개씩 하는 평범한 사람들

translation.en: who pay taxes while living paycheck to paycheck.
They're working longer and harder these days, and...
translation.ko: 최근 들어 더 오랜 시간을 더 힘들게 일해야 하는 분들을

translation.en: they should not be forgotten.
-Are you going to be giving again? -No more questions.
translation.ko: - 기부 계속하실 건가요? - 질문 그만 받겠습니다

translation.en: That was, uh...
unexpected.
Yeah, no kidding. How did they know where to find us?
Someone must have followed us from the station.
Looks like we're not gonna able to stop people from talking about Good Sam.
translation.ko: 이제 굿 샘 얘기는 통제 불가능해 보이네요

translation.en: I guess not.
You know, I noticed that what you told the reporters
was almost word for word what you said in our interview.
translation.ko: 우리 인터뷰에서 한 말이랑 거의 똑같던데요

translation.en: -Really? -Mm-hmm.
Guess I rehearsed too much last night.
Probably over-prepared for our interview.
I'm glad I did, though. -You were phenomenal. -[laughs]
translation.ko: 그래도 하길 잘했다 싶어요 당신도 끝내줬죠

translation.en: I think, uh... I think you're gonna be able to leverage this story for...
whatever you want.
Anchor, network, write your ticket.
translation.ko: 앵커든 전국 방송국 진출이든 해달란 대로 해주겠죠

translation.en: That's not what I want out of this story.
Okay. Well, uh...
what, um...
what do you want then?
Why were you looking for me, for Good Sam?
Because he's...
You are exactly what I didn't think existed.
translation.ko: 당신은 내가 믿지 않았던 존재 그 자체니까요

translation.en: Someone doing good, expecting nothing in return.
translation.ko: 아무 대가를 바라지 않고 선행을 베푸는 사람요

translation.en: glad you found me then.
Oh, um...
That's not what I meant. I...
Sorry, I...
I thought that, um...
-there was a spark between us. -No, no, there was, but...
translation.ko: - 서로 끌렸다고 생각했어요 - 맞아요, 하지만 당신은...

translation.en: you're my story now.
Look, it's been a long day.
-Would you mind just taking me home? -Yeah. Of course.
Let's, uh... Let's hop on the bridge.
-[driver] Mm-hmm. -Thanks.
[Kate] Hey.
I, um... I've been texting you but hadn't heard back yet.
Sorry, it's been a... -Been a rough shift. -Oh.
And I was a little thrown the other night when your Good Sam showed up.
translation.ko: 그날 밤 일도 당황스러웠고요 그 굿 샘이 나타났을 때요

translation.en: Yeah. No, I was as surprised as you.
Really?
Thought he was your father's friend.
And I, uh, saw him leading you out of a restaurant last night on Channel 9.
translation.ko: 어젯밤 채널 9 보니 그 남자랑 식당에서 나가던데요

translation.en: Well, he's the subject of my story.
[woman] Anybody want a coffee? I'm going.
I'd say you've got your hands full.
Well, are we still on for dinner tomorrow night?
translation.ko: 우리 내일 같이 저녁 먹는 거 맞죠?

translation.en: I'll text you.
Come on, guys. Get a move on!
[man] Hustle, hustle, hustle!
[Eric] Let's go. Come on!
[woman] Moving out!
Oh, my God, look. You have to see this.
National News Dispatch, New York Daily View,
and don't even get me started on your emails.
Your interview has over a million views online.
-I'm sorry, did you say a million? -Yeah.
-Well done, Kate. Good job. -All right, people. Listen up.
Last night's interview with Good Sam
got us the highest ratings in the station's history.
translation.ko: 우리 방송국 역대 최고의 시청률을 기록했다

translation.en: Thanks to Kate, who got the interview
translation.ko: 다 케이트의 공이지 뉴욕의 모든 방송국 나아가 전국 모든 방송국이

translation.en: that every station and every network, I might add, was trying to get.
translation.ko: 뉴욕의 모든 방송국 나아가 전국 모든 방송국이 잡으려고 혈안이던 인터뷰를 따냈으니까

translation.en: And the story keeps growing.
Lauren, tell her about the call we got from Washington Heights.
translation.ko: 로런, 워싱턴하이츠에서 제보 온 거 말해봐

translation.en: A woman called to say she started an Anonymous Good Samaritan Club.
translation.ko: '익명의 선한 사마리아인 클럽'을 결성했단 여자가 전화했어

translation.en: They'll be following Good Sam's philosophy.
They've already bought a wheelchair for a veteran in their neighborhood.
And some guy in line at the grocery store in Staten Island
translation.ko: 스태튼아일랜드의 식료품점에 줄 서 있던 남자가

translation.en: anonymously paid for the next ten people.
translation.ko: 익명으로 뒤에 있던 10명 걸 다 계산했대

translation.en: -Wow. -Kate, see if you can get Hansen -to talk on camera to people he helped. -Sure.
translation.ko: 핸슨한테 그간 도운 사람들과 같이 출연해달라고 해봐

translation.en: Lauren, give me man-in-the-street-type interviews.
Ed, see if you can get some reaction from workers on Good Sam's philosophy.
translation.ko: 에드는 굿 샘의 철학에 대한 노동자들 반응을 알아봐

translation.en: This is our time, people.
Let's take this story higher, huh? Yeah! Woo!
Guys, look! It's Good Sam.
[Christina] Good Sam!
Don't worry. You're gonna be great.
[Jack] Christina.
Hi.
Oh, Good Sam.
I can't thank you enough for what you did for my family.
translation.ko: 우리 가족에게 해주신 일을 어떻게 감사해야 할지 모르겠어요

translation.en: But how did you know we needed help?
[Jack] I had a system for finding out who was in need.
translation.ko: 처지가 어려운 분들을 찾아내는 시스템이 있죠

translation.en: Uh, Jack, you said that you knew about Christina's situation
translation.ko: 잭, 비서가 크리스티나랑 같은 교회에 다녀서

translation.en: because your assistant attends her church.
Oh, who is it? I want to thank her.
Carla...
Muñoz. Um...
Long dark hair, brown eyes.
She said that your faith, uh, inspired her.
Uh, Kate, are we just about wrapped up here?
I'm late for a meeting.
I just have a couple more questions.
It's gonna have to wait, unfortunately.
Sorry, Christina.
-We're done? -Uh, yeah. Thanks, Christina.
Hey, is everything okay?
Uh, yeah, yeah. Uh...
I'm headed to Senator Wintour's party tonight. I'll see you there?
translation.ko: 저녁에 윈터 상원의원의 파티에 갈 건데, 거기서 볼래요?

translation.en: Oh, um, I wasn't planning on it. My dad's in DC.
translation.ko: 전 갈 계획 없었어요 아빠는 워싱턴에 계시거든요

translation.en: Still, he's a family friend, right? And I'm going there.
translation.ko: 가족끼리 가까운 분이잖아요 나도 있을 테고요

translation.en: It'll be fun.
Okay, I'll think about it.
Thanks. Don't know how he'll get through meetings
when all anyone's talking about is Good Sam.
translation.ko: 다들 굿 샘 얘기만 할 거 아니야

translation.en: Something was off with Jack today.
Well, it's a lot to take in.
One day, he's managing a hedge fund, the next, he's on the national news.
translation.ko: 헤지펀드 운용하던 사람이 별안간 전국 방송을 탔잖아

translation.en: Still, though...
He seemed incredibly uncomfortable around Christina.
translation.ko: 크리스티나랑 있는 게 많이 불편해 보였어

translation.en: Maybe he felt awkward.
He just gave the woman $100,000. What's there to feel awkward about?
translation.ko: 자기가 10만 달러나 준 사람인데 어색할 게 뭐 있어?

translation.en: Yeah, well, when I give someone $100,000, I'll let you know.
translation.ko: 난 그런 돈 기부 안 해봐서 모르겠네요

translation.en: Fair enough.
[Jack] I wanted to lend a hand
in the best way that I could...
translation.ko: 제가 할 수 있는 최선의 방법으로요

translation.en: to the people who keep our factories open...
who fix our cars and our plumbing...
who bake our bread...
How many times are you gonna watch the Good Sam interview you did with Jack Hansen?
translation.ko: 이 잭 핸슨 인터뷰는 몇 번이나 돌려볼 작정이야?

translation.en: As many times as it takes for me to figure this thing out.
translation.ko: 답이 나올 때까지 몇 번이든 봐야지

translation.en: He's up to something. I just don't know what it is yet.
Here, watch this.
-I wanted to... -As Good Sam...
-...help the workers. -...I want to help the workers.
[both] Regular people who work two jobs to put a roof over their families' heads.
translation.ko: 가족이 살 곳을 마련하고자 일을 두 개씩 하는 평범한 사람들

translation.en: Who pay taxes while living paycheck to paycheck...
Look, the soundbites are near perfect.
It's almost too polished.
Yeah, you're right. Solid delivery, too.
-Mm-hmm. -[both] They should not be forgotten.
[Kate] Yet, some of the people you helped weren't needy or poor.
translation.ko: 도움 주신 분 중엔 곤궁하지 않은 분도 있는데요

translation.en: -Can you do me a favor? -Yeah.
Will you please tell David that I am chasing a lead at an event tonight?
translation.ko: 데이비드한테 가서 오늘 밤 행사 하나 취재 간다고 전해줄래?

translation.en: Tonight? Why are you leaving now?
Ah, because it's black tie,
which means I probably should've started getting ready two hours ago.
-Right. -Thanks.
[Kate] I know. I know.
David, I'm sorry I bailed on work, but I can't tell you where I am right now.
translation.ko: 데이비드, 조퇴한 건 죄송하지만 지금은 어딘지 말 못 해요

translation.en: At least, not just yet.
But I promise you, no other reporter is with Good Sam tonight.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 굿 샘을 만나는 기자는 저밖에 없으니 안심하세요

translation.en: Okay. I'll call you later.
Hi. My name is Kate Bradley. I'm Ashok Bradley's daughter.
translation.ko: 전 케이트 브래들리예요 아쇼크 브래들리의 딸이죠

translation.en: -Sorry, I don't see you on the list. -Um...
Could you just tell Senator Wintour I'm here, please?
This is a private party.
-Kate! -Hi!
What a surprise! I didn't know you were coming.
-It's okay. -May I take your things?
Please. Thanks.
Come in.
It was a last-minute decision. I hope you don't mind.
translation.ko: 불쑥 왔는데 폐가 된 건 아니죠?

translation.en: -No. -It's so nice to see you, Tom.
So, listen, you know Ashok's not here, right?
translation.ko: 네 아빠는 안 오는 거 알지?

translation.en: No, I know. He's still in DC.
Um, I'm actually not here to see him. I'm-- I'm looking for Jack Hansen.
translation.ko: 실은 아빠가 아니라 잭 핸슨을 만나러 왔어요

translation.en: Okay, so...
you know about the big announcement, then?
Uh... big announcement?
I'll let him tell you.
-Look, he's around here somewhere, so... -I'll find him.
-Nice to see you. -Nice to see you.
Thank you so, so much.
Wow, this is the best surprise of the evening. You look astonishing.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 최고의 깜짝 선물이네요 정말 눈부셔요

translation.en: Thank you.
I'm, uh, happy you made it after all.
Me, too.
Hey, so, what's this big announcement that Tom told me about?
translation.ko: 근데 톰이 말하는 중대 발표가 뭐죠?

translation.en: Oh. I'm, uh...
I'm running for Congress.
What?
-When did you decide this? -Uh...
A group of businessmen approached me and...
convinced me to run.
So, wait. Um... In our interview, when you were talking about the workers,
translation.ko: 잠깐, 우리 인터뷰에서 노동자들 얘기 했잖아요

translation.en: the ones who live paycheck to paycheck, that was...
What? That was your campaign statement?
Kate, no. I-I believe everything that I said.
translation.ko: 아니에요, 케이트 난 내가 믿는 대로 말했어요

translation.en: It's why I gave away that money. It's why I'm running for Congress.
translation.ko: 그래서 돈을 나눠줬고 그래서 출마하는 거예요

translation.en: So...
how do you explain the gift to Marie?
Uh... Marie?
Yeah, she's the oncologist who works at Parkland Hospital.
translation.ko: 파크랜드 병원에서 일하는 암 전문의 있잖아요

translation.en: Lives in a three-million-dollar house in Fort Greene.
Not exactly one of the workers that you claim to want to help.
translation.ko: 당신이 돕고 싶다는 노동자랑은 많이 다르잖아요

translation.en: Yeah, but, um...
she-- she also... uh, is on a number of charitable boards,
translation.ko: 마리는 여러 자선 단체의 이사회에 참여하고 있고

translation.en: and I... I just had this feeling, like,
translation.ko: 마리는 여러 자선 단체의 이사회에 참여하고 있고 그 돈을 의미 있게 쓰리란 인상을 받았어요, 내가 옳았죠

translation.en: she would do something good with it, and she did.
translation.ko: 그 돈을 의미 있게 쓰리란 인상을 받았어요, 내가 옳았죠

translation.en: Look, Kate, I know that you're not a big fan of the political world,
translation.ko: 케이트, 당신이 정계에 반감이 있단 거 알아요

translation.en: but your dad's given me his full support.
-Really? -Yeah.
Wow.
Willing or not, you sure have figured out a way
to get the Bradleys involved in your big plan.
Look, um...
I'm gonna make a formal announcement on Friday,
and I'd love to give you an exclusive interview.
But, until then, can we keep this between me and you?
Sure. Why not?
[Wintour] Well, there you two are.
Kate, I've put you and Jack at our table.
Candace wants to catch up on everything you're doing.
translation.ko: 캔디스가 너희 얘기 듣고 싶어 안달이거든 그럴게요

translation.en: You heard the big news?
Indeed I did, and been promised an exclusive interview.
Jack, the 12th District's a real coveted seat.
And I think his idea of protecting the workers of this city
translation.ko: 도시의 노동자를 지키자는 이 친구 주장이

translation.en: is gonna be a real breath of fresh air.
Jack, my boy, come with me. There's somebody I want you to meet.
translation.ko: 잭, 같이 가지 소개할 사람들이 있어

translation.en: David, I've got something.
Jack Hansen is running for Congress in the 12th District.
-No kidding? -I'd vote for him, for sure.
[David] How do you know this?
I, uh... I crashed a party at Senator Wintour's house last night.
translation.ko: 어제 초대도 안 받은 윈터 상원의원 파티에 갔었죠

translation.en: He could give the incumbent a run, now that Hansen's a name people know.
translation.ko: 현직이 재선에 도전해도 되는데 핸슨의 유명세에 밀렸군

translation.en: Yeah, thanks to us.
He's running on a public image that we created for him.
translation.ko: 우리가 대중한테 만들어준 자기 이미지를 써먹는 거예요

translation.en: It was never actual news.
Just a performance by yet another ambitious politician.
Well, at least Jack Hansen's trying to help people. We could do worse.
translation.ko: 최소한 남들을 도왔잖아 구린 짓보단 낫지

translation.en: [scoffs] Don't you get it?
He used us.
-[cell phone vibrates] -Keep digging.
Sorry, guys.
Hey, Dad. Thanks for calling me back.
[Ashok] My assistant said it was urgent.
It is. Jack just told me he's running for Congress.
I thought you said it was urgent. I left a Senate Finance Committee meeting.
translation.ko: 재정위 회의 도중에 나왔더니만 겨우 그 얘기냐?

translation.en: [Kate] Dad, please.
I need to know when Jack decided to run.
When hasn't he talked about running for office?
Was it the 12th District?
I remember a while back, he asked if he had a shot.
translation.ko: 한참 전에 자기도 가능성이 있을지 묻더구나

translation.en: And what? You said yes?
Are you backing him?
Well, actually, at the time, I said no.
The people who'd had that position were always household names,
and Jack really didn't have that.
Not yet, anyway.
Not until he created Good Sam to get everyone's attention.
translation.ko: 굿 샘 건을 벌여서 모두의 관심을 받고 있으니까요

translation.en: Well, you can't really fault him
for taking advantage of notoriety.
And, as a Congressional candidate,
maybe he can take this generosity movement and...
make some real change with it.
Dad, it's manipulative.
Can't you see that?
All right. Listen, I-I gotta go. I'll, um... I'll call you later.
-[Eric] You all done? -[Kate] Yes.
Hey, sit. I got it.
Okay, thanks.
You weren't lying, by the way. You are a really good cook.
Well, you know, you pick up a thing or two cooking for the guys at the fire station.
translation.ko: 소방서에서 다 같이 먹을 걸 만들며 익힌 솜씨죠

translation.en: Listen, I think I made some assumptions about you and Jack.
translation.ko: 당신이랑 잭에 대해 나름의 가정을 해봤는데

translation.en: And, um, I hope I misread some things.
Jack is just my interview subject.
And it turns out you were right not to trust him.
He's running for Congress.
He launched a political career after coming forward as Good Sam.
translation.ko: 굿 샘이라고 나선 게 정계 진출을 위한 포석이었다?

translation.en: [Kate] Exactly.
Just further proof
that no one does anything good without expecting something in return.
translation.ko: 대가를 바라지 않고 선행을 베푸는 사람은 없다니까요

translation.en: I like to think that's not true.
-Coffee? -Ooh, yeah. Thanks.
So did you fix this place up yourself?
Because, man, it's amazing.
[Eric] Yeah. It's a work in progress.
Is this you captaining this beautiful sailboat?
translation.ko: 이 근사한 요트의 선장으로 보이는 게 당신인가요?

translation.en: Yeah. That's when me and my brother took the crew up to a friend's place in Maine.
translation.ko: 네, 패트릭이랑 다른 몇몇과 메인에 사는 친구한테 갔었죠

translation.en: Camden Harbor.
-Is this Patrick? -Yeah.
He was always the first one on the boat and the last one off.
translation.ko: 늘 배에 제일 먼저 타고 제일 늦게 내려서

translation.en: Everyone called him Fish.
Hmm, Fish.
-Did you have a nickname? -Hawkins.
Like the kid from Treasure Island.
Hawkins. I like that.
And who's that?
Um, just a friend of my brother's.
So is this what dinner's always like with a reporter? All the questions.
translation.ko: 기자랑 밥 먹으면 원래 이래요? 질문이 끝이 없네요

translation.en: Pretty much. When was the last time you went sailing?
translation.ko: 그런 편이죠 마지막으로 요트 탄 건 언제예요?

translation.en: Come on. That wasn't a hard one, was it?
Not since Patrick died.
It just hasn't felt right without him.
I'm sorry. I-I didn't realize.
Do you mind if I ask what happened?
Ah, you don't wanna hear about that.
I'm listening, if you want to tell me.
My brother and I went sailing in May for my birthday.
translation.ko: 지난 5월 내 생일 때 같이 요트를 타고 나갔어요

translation.en: And he was so excited...
about this new route that he'd planned out and...
and the surprise he had for me when we got there.
translation.ko: 도착하고 나한테 주려던 깜짝 선물 때문에요

translation.en: And the weather was perfect.
Sun in the sky, a few clouds.
And then the wind just picked up,
and all of a sudden...
this wall of water just came toward us.
And the boom swung loose and...
hit Patrick in the head, knocked us both overboard.
translation.ko: 패트릭의 머리를 쳤어요 우린 배 밖으로 떨어졌죠

translation.en: I had to fight through the swell to get to him.
translation.ko: 있는 힘을 다해 물살을 헤치고 패트릭한테 갔는데

translation.en: And he was unconscious,
and bleeding a lot.
I tried CPR, but...
I lost him.
I'm so sorry.
You see, I'm not the hero everyone thinks I am.
translation.ko: 난 남들이 생각하는 그런 영웅이 아니에요

translation.en: I couldn't even save my own brother.
Hey, you did everything you could.
You risked your life to save him.
You do that every single day.
You may not think you're a hero...
but I do.
Hey, Stephanie. It's Kate from Channel 12 trying you again.
Can you please call me back when you get a chance? Thanks.
Hey, look at this. There's a hidden column in the spreadsheet. A note section.
translation.ko: 여기 좀 봐 스프레드시트에 숨겨진 칼럼이 있고 메모가 돼 있어

translation.en: -[Kate] Anything interesting? -[Lauren] Um...
On the first 400-grand withdrawal from Jack, there's some initials.
translation.ko: 잭이 처음 40만 달러 인출한 항목에 이니셜이 적혀있어

translation.en: PDD. Is that one of the people who got money?
translation.ko: PDD라고 돼 있네 돈 받은 사람 이니셜이야?

translation.en: -Mmm, no. No one has the initials PDD. -[cell phone vibrates]
Hey, Stephanie. Thanks for calling me back.
Yeah, sure. What's up, Kate?
[Kate] When you found me and Jack at that taco place,
how did you know where he'd be?
He sent out a press release.
A press release?
Yeah. Or his publicist put it out.
Carl... Carl Green at, uh...
PDD. PDD?
[Stephanie] Yeah, Parker Dunlop Development.
Right.
Okay, thanks, Steph. I owe you one.
What's going on?
-PDD is Parker Dunlop Development. -Oh.
-What? -It's a political consulting agency.
-Very high-end. -They groom candidates for public office.
translation.ko: 정치 컨설팅 회사지, 초일류야 공직 선거에 대비해 후보를 준비시켜

translation.en: Uh, campaigns, policy, media coaching.
translation.ko: 선거 운동, 공약 준비 언론 코칭 같은 거

translation.en: Yeah. My dad used them in the last election.
translation.ko: 아빠도 지난 선거 때 거길 썼어

translation.en: But why would they get paid in cash?
Oh, Lauren.
You have so much to learn about DC.
Okay, hold on. When was the second $400,000 withdrawal?
October 27th.
[Kate] Right.
The day after Jack and I had dinner and talked about Good Sam.
translation.ko: 잭이랑 저녁 먹으면서 굿 샘 얘기한 다음 날이야

translation.en: So if Jack's first 400,000 was spent on political consulting instead--
translation.ko: 잭이 처음 인출한 40만 달러가 정치 컨설팅 회사로 갔다면...

translation.en: Then who was behind the money in the first four bags?
translation.ko: 처음 4명이 받은 돈은 누가 준 거지?

translation.en: Where are you going?
When were you gonna tell me that you weren't Good Sam?
translation.ko: 대체 언제까지 굿 샘인 척할 작정이었죠?

translation.en: I'm gonna call you back.
What are you talking about? Of course I'm Good Sam.
translation.ko: 무슨 말이에요? 내가 굿 샘 맞아요

translation.en: But you didn't tell me the whole story, now, did you, Jack?
The first $400,000 you spent on campaign expenses?
PDD?
Why don't you tell me the truth, Jack? And tell me like it really happened.
translation.ko: 왜 사실대로 말 안 했죠? 지금이라도 있는 그대로 말해요

translation.en: I did give away the last 400,000.
translation.ko: 마지막 40만 달러는 내가 준 게 맞아요

translation.en: And the rest?
Somebody else gave that away. I don't know who.
And you just took credit for it?
Look...
Um, I'd never seen anything like the media attention the guy was getting.
translation.ko: 한 사람한테 그 정도로 언론의 관심이 쏠리는 건 처음 봤어요

translation.en: Everywhere I went, people were talking about Good Sam. Even you.
translation.ko: 어딜 가나 모두 굿 샘 얘기였죠 당신도요

translation.en: And I know how important it is for you to find someone doing good.
translation.ko: 그런 선행의 주인공을 찾는 게 당신한테 얼마나 중요한지도 알았죠

translation.en: I'm that guy.
I wasn't just looking for someone doing good, Jack.
translation.ko: 단순한 선행의 주인공을 찾던 게 아니었어요

translation.en: I was looking for someone doing good who didn't expect anything in return,
translation.ko: 대가를 바라지 않고 선행을 베푸는 사람을 찾았던 거죠

translation.en: and that is not you.
I might not be the guy who started this whole thing, but...
translation.ko: 내가 그 모든 걸 시작한 당사자는 아니지만

translation.en: I did. I gave away $400,000. That's got to count for something.
translation.ko: 나도 40만 달러를 기부했어요 그것도 의미 있는 일이죠

translation.en: You gave money away for publicity so that you could run for Congress.
translation.ko: 출마 때문에 홍보 효과를 노리고 쓴 돈이잖아요

translation.en: Kate, we're both getting a lot of mileage out of this story.
translation.ko: 케이트, 우리 둘 다 이번 일로 큰 이익을 봤죠

translation.en: That's what this is about? Mileage?
You lied, Jack.
So, what, the truth doesn't matter as long as you get what you want. Is that it?
translation.ko: 목적만 달성하면 진실은 아무래도 좋단 건가요?

translation.en: Okay, how-- how-- how can I fix this... with you?
Would it make a difference if I gave away another $400,000?
Wow.
Where does the truth end and the lie begin?
Hold on. Let's talk about this.
Kate!
Kate...
What? Say that again.
[Kate] I said Jack Hansen isn't Good Sam.
This is the kind of thing that ruins a station's reputation and kills careers.
translation.ko: 방송국 평판에 우리 경력까지 말아먹을 대참사군

translation.en: -Yours and mine. -David, let her talk.
He lied to me.
He just admitted that he's a copycat.
After the real Good Sam gave away $400,000,
translation.ko: 진짜 굿 샘이 40만 달러를 나눠주고 나서

translation.en: -Jack stepped in and did the same thing. -Great.
He's been working with a DC press agent for months.
translation.ko: 잭은 몇 달 전부터 워싱턴의 홍보 전문가랑 작업해왔어요

translation.en: We got played.
Okay, so if Jack Hansen isn't Good Sam, then who is?
translation.ko: 잭 핸슨이 아니라면 누가 굿 샘이지?

translation.en: Well, maybe the real Good Sam's in hiding, you know, to protect his identity.
translation.ko: 진짜는 자기 신원을 감추려고 숨어있을 수도 있죠

translation.en: Maybe he's got his own agenda. A marketing ploy.
translation.ko: 다른 목적이 있을 수도 있어요 마케팅 전략 같은 거

translation.en: There's always the criminal angle. The money's some kinda repayment?
translation.ko: 범죄가 엮였거나 은혜를 갚는 걸지도 몰라요

translation.en: Guys, I don't think the real Good Sam is doing this for anything.
translation.ko: 내 생각에 진짜 굿 샘은 순수한 마음인 거 같아요

translation.en: Oh, come on.
No, I'm serious.
Look, when I first got put on the story,
I was sure Good Sam had some ulterior motive.
translation.ko: 굿 샘에게 어떤 저의가 있다고 확신했죠

translation.en: I've been working the bummer beat for years...
translation.ko: 전 몇 년째 사건, 사고를 취재해왔어요

translation.en: and we know it always gets the ratings.
But we choose to show the selfish, violent things people do every day,
translation.ko: 날마다 사람들이 저지르는 이기적이고 폭력적인 일만 골라서 보여준 거예요

translation.en: when we know that there are way more people out there doing good.
translation.ko: 좋은 일 하는 사람들이 훨씬 많은 걸 알면서도요

translation.en: Oh, that's a real nice sentiment, Kate. I'm getting all choked up here.
translation.ko: 혼자 훈훈해서 좋겠군 난 숨이 막혀 죽겠다고

translation.en: But that doesn't tell us who the real Good Sam is.
translation.ko: 지금은 진짜 굿 샘을 찾는 게 급선무야

translation.en: -Come on, people. Have we got any ideas? -Not yet.
But we've gotta go back to the first four money drops.
Christina, Marie, Jesse, and Faith.
-Find out what they have in common. -[David] Let me think.
Where do they all live?
All over. Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Staten Island.
translation.ko: 다 달라요, 브롱크스, 브루클린 맨해튼, 스태튼아일랜드

translation.en: All right, so that's not it. What about schools, clubs, associations?
translation.ko: 그건 제끼고 학교, 모임, 협회 같은 건?

translation.en: -Anything in common? -No, nothing. We checked.
-All born in New York? -Marie was born in Brooklyn.
-Faith was born here, too. -[Lauren] No. No go.
Christina was born in Mexico and Jesse's from Maine, Camden Harbor.
[Kate] Sorry, what?
Oh, Camden Harbor on the coast of Maine.
Camden Harbor...
Okay, I-I, uh-- I have a hunch. I'll call you back.
No, no, no, wait, wait. Where are you? I'll send a news van.
translation.ko: 잠깐 끊지 마, 지금 어디야? 취재 차량 보낼게

translation.en: You can't shoot a hunch, David. Give me some time.
translation.ko: 감만 갖고 어떻게 촬영해요? 시간을 주세요

translation.en: [David] No, Kate, wait. Just--
Taxi.
Do you think this could be the--
I-I hurt my back a while ago.
Wait here, please.
Hey, Jesse. Uh, you got a couple of minutes to talk about Good Sam?
translation.ko: 제시, 잠깐 굿 샘에 대해 얘기하고 싶은데요

translation.en: I'm running behind.
Well, I saw a photo of someone who looked like you
translation.ko: 얼마 전에 사진에서 당신과 닮은 사람을 봤어요

translation.en: on a sailboat with Patrick and Eric Hayes.
translation.ko: 패트릭, 에릭 헤이스랑 요트에서 찍은 사진요

translation.en: Sailing with the Hayes boys.
It's probably me then, yeah. So you knew them?
translation.ko: - 나일 수도 있겠네요 - 두 사람을 아세요?

translation.en: I was practically a member of the family.
Patrick was my best friend since fourth grade.
I did, uh, all the woodwork on his boat. You know, the Crazy Eight.
I'm sorry, you said the Crazy Eight?
Yeah.
Yeah, the accident really wrecked all of us.
translation.ko: 그 사고로 우리 모두 엉망이 됐었죠

translation.en: Eric more than anyone else, but... Are you doing a story about a sailboat?
translation.ko: 특히 에릭이 심했어요 요트에 대해 취재하나요?

translation.en: Yeah, in a way, I might be.
Hi, it's Kate from Channel 12 News. I have a question for you.
translation.ko: 채널 12 뉴스의 케이트예요 여쭤볼 게 있는데요

translation.en: Did you know Patrick Hayes?
[woman] Yeah. I, uh, worked with Patrick
at Inniswell Properties.
First job as a paralegal.
He was great at the business part,
but, uh, he had dyslexia, so reading wasn't easy for him.
I helped him with research, contracts...
translation.ko: 제가 자료 조사나 계약서 검토를 도왔었죠

translation.en: I was Patrick and Eric's babysitter.
I started when they were little kids,
and then they grew up right in front of my eyes.
Yes. Patrick Hayes was my patient several years ago.
translation.ko: 패트릭은 몇 년 전 제 환자였어요

translation.en: I can't discuss specifics, but I can say he made a remarkable recovery.
translation.ko: 자세한 내용은 말 못 하지만 경과가 아주 좋았죠

translation.en: He was always so grateful.
But I just did what doctors do.
But, um...
Patrick can't be your Good Sam...
because he died...
months ago.
-Hey. -[Kate] Hi.
-Uh, come on in. -Thanks.
-Uh, let me grab your things. -Thanks.
Christina Gomez was your babysitter when you and Patrick were little.
translation.ko: 크리스티나 고메즈는 당신 형제의 어릴 적 보모였죠

translation.en: Faith Haywood's first job was at your brother's company.
translation.ko: 페이스 헤이우드의 첫 직장은 패트릭의 회사였고

translation.en: Dr. Ellis was Patrick's doctor when he was sick.
translation.ko: 엘리스 박사는 패트릭이 아플 때 담당 의사였어요

translation.en: And Jesse Durham was his best friend.
He used to go sailing with you guys all the time on the Crazy Eight.
You're Good Sam, aren't you?
Come on in. Let's talk.
Thanks.
So...
where did you get all this money to give away?
translation.ko: 사람들에게 준 돈은 어떻게 구한 거예요?

translation.en: My brother's boat was destroyed in the accident.
And, uh...
I got an insurance check...
for over 400 grand.
I told them that it wasn't my boat, but...
as it turns out, Patrick transferred the ownership to me.
Apparently, that was my surprise.
He was giving me the Crazy Eight for my birthday.
But I failed him.
So I couldn't keep the money.
So that's why you gave it all away.
There are these friends of his...
who really made his life better.
You know, in different ways.
I just thought...
they deserved it more than me.
translation.ko: 나보다 더 돈을 받을 자격이 있었어요

translation.en: But why not just give the money to them directly?
I thought they'd enjoy it more and...
do what they needed with it if they weren't weighed down by where it came from.
translation.ko: 더 편한 마음으로 요긴하게 쓸 수 있을 거라 생각했어요

translation.en: I'm really sorry about your brother.
But I think he'd be so proud of what you've done here.
translation.ko: 패트릭도 당신이 한 일을 뿌듯하게 여길 거예요

translation.en: Thanks.
But I cannot be your story.
translation.ko: 난 당신 뉴스에 나갈 수 없어요

translation.en: It's not about a story.
Not anymore.
Channel 12 News has learned
that Jack Hansen is not the Good Samaritan he claimed to be.
translation.ko: 자신이 굿 샘이란 잭 핸슨의 주장이 거짓임을 확인했습니다

translation.en: While Jack Hansen did give away the last $400,000,
translation.ko: 잭 핸슨은 마지막 40만 달러를 기부한 건 맞지만

translation.en: he was not behind the first four gifts.
Rather, he copied the original Good Sam
in order to promote his own political ambitions.
So who is the real Good Sam?
Unlike Hansen, he seeks no attention.
translation.ko: 그는 핸슨과 달리 대중의 주목을 원치 않았습니다

translation.en: Instead, he's asked to remain anonymous, expecting nothing in return.
translation.ko: "굿 샘은 익명으로 남을 것" 어떠한 대가도 바라지 않으며 익명으로 남을 것을 요청했습니다

translation.en: And a remarkable thing has happened.
The recipients of Good Sam's generosity became Good Sams themselves.
translation.ko: 굿 샘의 선물을 받은 수혜자들이 스스로 굿 샘이 된 것입니다

translation.en: One gave a car to her neighbor.
One, a substantial donation to a local food bank.
translation.ko: 다른 수혜자는 인근 푸드 뱅크에 상당액을 기부했으며

translation.en: Another started a scholarship for paralegals hoping to become lawyers.
translation.ko: 변호사를 꿈꾸는 법률 보조원을 위한 장학기금을 시작한 수혜자도 있습니다

translation.en: The recipient in Brooklyn gave all the money to cancer research.
translation.ko: 브루클린의 수혜자는 전액을 암 치료 연구단체에 기부했습니다

translation.en: What Good Sam never expected
was that we would be inspired by his example.
translation.ko: 그의 행동이 우리 모두를 변화시킨 겁니다

translation.en: Some people say New York City is a tough place.
A place where everyone's out for themselves.
But as I look across our city,
I see more kindness between strangers than competition.
translation.ko: 낯선 이들 사이에도 경쟁보단 호의가 더 많이 오가는 것을 봤고

translation.en: I see people reaching out to help others...
translation.ko: 타인을 돕고자 나서는 사람들을 볼 수 있었습니다

translation.en: on street corners, subway platforms, and in apartment hallways.
translation.ko: 거리, 전철 승강구 아파트 복도 어디서나요

translation.en: Thanks to Good Sam,
we're becoming better versions of ourselves.
translation.ko: 우리는 더 나은 사람이 되고 있습니다

translation.en: Kate Bradley, Channel 12 News.
-Good work. -Thanks.
-Beautiful reporting, Kate. -Thank you.
[Kate] Bye, guys.
Hey, Dad.
I saw your report on Jack Hansen.
translation.ko: 잭 핸슨에 대한 네 뉴스 봤다

translation.en: You were right about him all along.
I should have trusted your instincts.
That's okay. I appreciate that, Dad.
Whoever the real Good Sam is,
a man like that makes us see the world... differently.
translation.ko: 그런 사람 덕분에 우리가 세상을 달리 보게 되는 거란다

translation.en: You haven't met him, but I think you'd really like him.
Anyone that makes you happy is all right by me.
Thanks, Dad.
-Night, Katie. -Okay, good night. Love you.
-[Kate laughs] I was not flirting. -[Eric laughs]
-[Eric] Really? Not even a little? -[Kate] Okay, maybe a little.
translation.ko: "한 달 후" - 정말? 전혀 아니었다고? - 아주 살짝?

translation.en: -So I brought a little surprise for you. -Oh.
-Close your eyes. -Okay.
All right.
Open.
[Kate gasps] Cool.
Are we going stargazing?
Not quite.
It's a clue for where I'm gonna take you tomorrow.
translation.ko: 내일 자기랑 갈 곳에 대한 힌트야

translation.en: Hayden Planetarium?
The North Pole?
A pirate-themed party?
That's actually closer. It's on the water.
The Brooklyn Bridge?
Are you asking me to go sailing?
Yeah, I am.
And look at that. For once, it's me asking you questions.
translation.ko: 이야, 나도 자기한테 문제 낼 때가 다 있네

translation.en: [woman] Uh, hello?
I think you've got a fan.
Hi.
-Excuse me, are you Kate Bradley? -[Kate] Yeah.
translation.ko: - 안녕하세요 - 케이트 브래들리 기자 맞죠? - 그런데요 - 채널 12요?

translation.en: -From Channel 12? -Mm-hmm.
I was wondering if you would, uh, thank Good Sam for me.
translation.ko: 굿 샘한테 저 대신 감사 인사 전해주실래요?

translation.en: Sure, but what for?
I just received a scholarship to go to college.
translation.ko: 제가 장학금을 받고 대학에 가게 됐는데요

translation.en: The school didn't know where it came from,
but I thought for sure it was from Good Sam.
translation.ko: 기자님이 취재했던 굿 샘이 확실한 거 같아요

translation.en: Um... a full scholarship?
All four years. [chuckles]
Other kids in my graduating class got them as well,
translation.ko: 우리 학교 다니는 다른 애들도 받았어요

translation.en: plus kids in other schools.
We all received one of these.
Do you think it's from Good Sam?
I don't know. I'd have to ask him.
Oh, I gotta run, but if it is Good Sam behind all of this...
translation.ko: 가봐야겠어요 만약 굿 샘이 한 일이라면

translation.en: [exhales] ...thank him for me.
Sure. Yeah, definitely.
Do you know anything about this?
It wasn't me.
Um... I'm doing my good deeds right here.
-And tomorrow, when I take you sailing. -Mm-hmm.
translation.ko: - 내일 같이 배 타러 가는 거다? - 응

translation.en: So wait. Really, you had nothing to do with that?
[laughs] I swear.
You really want to chase that story, don't you?
Kind of.
Go ahead. I can wait.
Mmm... in a second.
Okay. I'll be back.
Excuse me!
Wait! Excuse me!
